adjectives.description: forkable (comparative more forkable, superlative most forkable)

entries.meaning: Capable of being moved or separated with a fork.
examples: Loss of so much moisture  […]  produces a sludge cake, which is generally forkable.

entries.meaning: (computing) Capable of being split into separate processes.
examples: The debugger will support any forkable Perl program, and you can see examples in this book in Chapter 9.

entries.meaning: (computing) Capable of being split into separate projects.
